dialogue.text: I tap on Maki’s name in my phone and wait for her to answer.
I’m not exactly sure how Ami will handle me inviting over the mother of her arch nemesis, but I’ll be damned if I let an obnoxious girl with A-cups rule my life.
I am an adult looking for another adult to do adult things with- and Maki is the only adult I know who is very rarely busy with anything since her daughter can just take over.
I mean, I guess Sara would also work, but I feel like it’s a lot easier to sell porn than it is to revitalize a failing bar. No offense, Sana.
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!
Why are you screaming?
I don't know. Can I come over?
I guess.
Just don’t be {i}too{/i} weird in front of my [niece]. She already kind of hates your daughter, so you’re kind of starting off on thin ice.
What? Why would anyone ever hate Makoto? Makoto is great.
I hope your [niece] is ready to throw hands.
Okay. Sending you the address now.
Sure! But I recently started selling lotion and-
I hang up the phone and quickly text Maki my address.
I make my way inside and prepare myself for what I hope will be a rather easy and dramaless night in.
Get out of here!
It appears that will not be the case.
I don’t know what I did, but-
You mean to tell me that for only 1,000 yen a month, I can get all of the lotion I want?!
That’s right, Ami! And this isn’t just {i}any{/i} lotion...it’s lotion {i}guaranteed{/i} to keep you looking [young]and energetic for the rest of eternity.
Ahh, that’s even better! My [uncle]’s not home right now so he won’t get mad at me for saying this, but he {i}really{/i} seems to like [younger_girls].
Does he now? Well, then I...totally understand why you’d want him to look at you that way!
Maybe I should just come back later.
Wait, Sensei?! Is that you or did somebody break in?!
Hah...Hi, Ami. And hi-
Just call me Ami 2!
No.
Now, I know what you’re thinking.
Do you really, though?
Of course! {i}You’re{/i} thinking...“Wow! Only 1,000 yen a month?! What a steal!”
Well, let me tell you this, buddy. It really all starts to make sense when you take a look at our business model.
You don’t even have any products with you.
She showed up with a whole suitcase of all different kinds of exotic lotions.

I thought it was a little strange when she knocked since we don’t really get a lot of door to door salespeople around here, but as soon as I smelled what was inside, I immediately knew what was going on.
I’m sure you did, Ami.
Oh my. It appears we may have a bit of a skeptic on our hands!
Tell me, fine sir who I have never met before, how would {i}you{/i} like to sample some of my one of a kind, {i}exotic{/i} hand lotions?
You mean the “hand lotions” I specifically asked you not to bring?
Wait, you were expecting her, Sensei? Did you set up an appointment thingy with this lady?
My birthday isn’t for a long time, so-
Wait, is this an early Christmas present?! You’re getting me a lifetime supply of youthful lotion so I can stay adorable forever?!
No. This is actually Makoto’s mom and all of that lotion is for me. I have very dry skin.
...What?
Why didn’t you just go along with it?
Better question, how did you manage to get here before me?
I just happened to be making my rounds in the area as a totally legitimate lotion sales rep! And since you {i}scheduled an appointment with me{/i}, I was {i}always{/i} going to show up.
Sensei, would you mind explaining to me what is going on here?
I kind of did already.
So this actually {i}is{/i} Makoto’s mom?
Uhh...yes! But just because I lied about my name doesn’t mean I lied about the product!
I {i}thought{/i} you looked familiar...
Anything for a sale, right? You're a true business woman, Ami 2.
It’s in my blood, obviously! My job is to sell things! And sometimes, in order to sell things, you need to lie about them!
How are you still in business?
Because I sell fucking porn, not security devices.
You sell {i}what{/i}?
Corn! Canned! Cobbed! Creamed! Any type of-
Pfft~
Corn...
Perhaps I should have played along.
And you know, maybe in another life, I would have.
But as Ami's little pogchamp, I owe it to her to be honest.
Even if it means sentencing her to a life of hating Makoto’s mother- something I’m already sure was going to happen anyway.
You betrayed me! I invite you into my house because your suitcase smells good and {i}this{/i} is how you repay me?!
Get out and never come back!
You're not my mom! I don't have to listen to you!
How many more Miyamuras are you going to invite into this household, Sensei?
If you wind up inviting a third, can you ask him to {i}at least{/i} come say hello to his daughter? She misses him.
I’m not inviting any other Miyamuras over to the house. One was more than enough and that still didn’t deter me from bringing in Maki and all of her fancy lotions.
I'm not Maki. I am Ami 2.
Get out of my house, you harlot!
Harlot? Is this the renaissance? Have some dignity and call me a whore like a normal girl.
I can’t tell which of you is worse! You or Makoto!
Obviously me! Makoto is great!
But seeing as I am no longer welcome here, I will start packing my things.
You’re not planning on leaving already, are you?
Why do you want her here when you have me?!
You’re actually okay with me staying?
Yeah. I still need to go through all of the lotions and figure out which one is best for my skin.
You can’t be serious!
I am serious. In fact...I am so serious, that I am, going to do {i}this.{/i}
Lay one finger on her and she’ll be leaving this house in a variety of different bags!
Ami-
Go to your room.
Ah...
You {i}didn’t...{/i}
Hah. Get parented, loser.
Right now, [young]lady.
I do my best to put on an adult voice, but I’m pretty sure it’s just my normal voice.
Probably because I’m an adult.
You...
Why do I...actually feel compelled to go to my room?...
Because starting right now, you are grounded.
For...for how long?!
Until Maki leaves. After that, you can do whatever.
Why am I in trouble when all I wanted to do was protect your honor?!
Be careful or he might {i}actually{/i} ground you.
Ami. Room.
GRAAAAAAH! I STILL HATE YOU AND YOUR STUPID DAUGHTER!
Ami [[miraculously] goes into her room and slams the door behind her.
And, in other news, I gained a new power today.
You know, if I knew this was going to turn into a whole thing, I would have just left the lotion behind.
You mean like I {i}asked{/i} you to?
Did you ask me something like that?
Maybe not in this game, but I swore I could have asked in the last one.
Huh. Either way-
You hung up on me and I wanted to spite you.
That aside, I think it’s safe to assume Ami hates you now.
Excellent.
Why is that excellent? Normally, when you get invited over to a person’s house, you’re supposed to try to {i}not{/i} make them hate you.
Normally, yes. But I came here with the knowledge that, for some reason, your fake daughter has a problem with my real daughter.
She is my [niece], not my daughter.
I bet she still thinks of you as her daddy.
Her real dad is actually dead, so...probably not.
Oh...crap.
I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to bring up bad memories.
It’s fine. I don’t have many memories of it in the first place.
Either way, I crossed a line and I’m sorry.
But, uhh...what I meant by the whole “excellent” comment is that now, by comparison, Ami will probably hate {i}me{/i} a little more than Makoto.
That wasn’t your plan from the start, was it?
No. I just really need the money and have to sell as many lotions as possible or I'm going to have to take out a second mortgage on my home.
Anyway, want to go out to a fancy restaurant or something? I will pay.
Sure. That sounds great.
{i}THAT’S RIGHT! RUN AWAY, MAKOTO’S MOM! THIS HOUSE BELONGS TO THE ARAKAWAS!
WAIT! NO! SENSEI! YOU HAVEN’T TOLD ME I CAN LEAVE MY ROOM YET!
Should you maybe let your [niece] out first? She might have to go to the bathroom at some point.
She’ll be fine. She’s well behaved when she wants to be.
NO! DON’T LEAVE ME!
ESPECIALLY NOT WITH A MIYAMURA!!!!!!!!!!!
Maki and I make our way over to some restaurant close to her shop so that, once we’re done, she can head back home to sub in for Makoto.
As it turns out, Maki was supposed to work tonight and Makoto was supposed to be helping Miku with something.
But, of course, whenever I ask anyone to do anything, they almost always drop their previous plans for me.
Just one of the perks of living in Kumon-mi, I guess.
Anyway, dinner is great and Maki winds up fronting the bill to pay for causing a disturbance at my house.
Was it a disturbance I both expected and created by inviting her there? Yes. But it’s not like I’m going to give away a free dinner in exchange for admitting that.
Instead, I’ll just shelve that idea alongside the thousands of others that I have pushed away from me in a never ending journey toward complacency.
The two of us split apart-
And I go home to let my [niece] out of her cage.
{i}Maki’s affection has increased to [maki_love]!{/i}
